title: Breastfeeding A Baby For Just 6 Months Can Reduce Similar Pollution Caused By 77,500 Cars
text:
Breastfeeding A Baby For Just 6 Months Can Reduce Similar Pollution Caused By 77,500 Cars

Breastfeeding A Baby For Just 6 Months Can Reduce Similar Pollution Caused By 77,500 Cars

Experts at Imperial College in London state that a mother should breastfeed for at least six months than switching to formula, as a lot of energy is needed to create the breast milk supplement and it is severely impacting the environment.

Representative Image: Rawpixel

Researchers for the first time calculated the impact production of formula has on the planet (published first in the BMJ) and the results are catastrophic.

They discovered that the formula production requires a lot of energy, and the production also releases a ton of fossil fuels that affects the environment considerably.

Milk needs to be heated to 70 degrees Celsius for producing formula. To put this into context, this much energy can charge 200 million phones in a year.

Moreover, just powdered cow's milk is not sufficient for the dietary needs of a growing baby. So additional ingredients like palm, coconut, sunflower, fungal, algal and fish oils are also added.

UK has one of the lowest breastfeeding rates across the globe, with just 34 percent kids feeding on breast milk.

Moreover, globally only 40 percent of babies are fed breast milk for six months. Rest eventually shift to formula. Health institutions in the UK recommend breastfeeding for at least 6 months.

Researchers said in a statement, "The production of unnecessary infant and toddler formulas exacerbates environmental damage and should be a matter of increasing global concern.

"We need to acknowledge that our house is on fire and that the next generation requires us to act quickly to reduce carbon footprints in every sphere of life.

Representative Image: Rawpixel

"Breastfeeding is a part of this jigsaw, and urgent investment is needed across the sector."

As per the researchers, if mothers breastfeed their kids for six months and not use formula, the impact on the environment will be similar to eliminating 77,500 cars from the road every year!
description: Experts at Imperial College in London state that a mother should breastfeed for at least six months than switching to formula, as a lot of energy is needed to create the breast milk supplement (also known as formula) and it is severely impacting the environment.
